intro: Agalinis communis, commonly known as the common blazingstar, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as prairies and roadsides. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to red, which attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and opposite, narrow leaves. Agalinis communis is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of soil types.
